props.name: variant
props.description: Creates a smaller or larger badge. Has no effect if the `size` prop is set

props.name: size
props.description: Sets the size of the badge in pixels. Overrides the `variant` prop when set

props.name: inline
props.description: Styles the badge to `display: inline`

props.name: size
props.description: Set the width and height of the icon in pixels.

props.name: isOpen
props.description: Whether or not the dialog is open

props.name: onDismiss
props.description: Function that will be called when the dialog is closed

props.name: returnFocusRef
props.description: The element to restore focus back to after the `Dialog` is closed

props.name: initialFocusRef
props.description: Element inside of the `Dialog` you'd like to be focused when the Dialog is opened. If nothing is passed to `initialFocusRef` the close button is focused.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Pass an id to use for the aria-label. Use either a `aria-label` or an `aria-labelledby` but not both.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Pass a label to be used to describe the Dialog. Use either a `aria-label` or an `aria-labelledby` but not both.

props.name: count
props.description: Number to be displayed in the list item

props.name: selected
props.description: Whether the list item is selected or not

props.name: small
props.description: Whether the list item is small or not

props.name: children
props.description: FilteredSearch is expected to contain an `ActionMenu` followed by a `TextInput`.

props.name: returnFocusRef
props.description: Ref for the element to focus when the `Overlay` is closed.

props.name: onClickOutside
props.description: Function to call when clicking outside of the `Overlay`. Typically this function sets the `Overlay` visibility state to `false`.

props.name: onEscape
props.description: Function to call when user presses `Escape`. Typically this function sets the `Overlay` visibility state to `false`.

props.name: ignoreClickRefs
props.description: An array of ref objects to ignore clicks on in the onOutsideClick behavior. This is often used to ignore clicking on the element that toggles the open/closed state for the Overlay to prevent the Overlay from being toggled twice.

props.name: initialFocusRef
props.description: Ref for the element to focus when the `Overlay` is opened. If nothing is provided, the first focusable element in the `Overlay` body is focused.

props.name: width
props.description: Sets the width of the `Overlay`, pick from our set list of widths, or pass `auto` to automatically set the width based on the content of the `Overlay`. `small` corresponds to `256px`, `medium` corresponds to `320px`, `large` corresponds to `480px`, `xlarge` corresponds to `640px`, `xxlarge` corresponds to `960px`.

props.name: height
props.description: Sets the height of the `Overlay`, pick from our set list of heights, or pass `auto` to automatically set the height based on the content of the `Overlay`. `xsmall` corresponds to `192px`, `small` corresponds to `256px`, `medium` corresponds to `320px`, `large` corresponds to `432px`, `xlarge` corresponds to `600px`.

props.name: maxHeight
props.description: Sets the maximum height of the `Overlay`, pick from our set list of heights. `xsmall` corresponds to `192px`, `small` corresponds to `256px`, `medium` corresponds to `320px`, `large` corresponds to `432px`, `xlarge` corresponds to `600px`.

props.name: visibility
props.description: Sets the visibility of the `Overlay`.

props.name: anchorSide
props.description: If provided, the Overlay will slide into position from the side of the anchor with a brief animation

props.name: top
props.description: The top CSS property of the Overlay — affects the vertical position.

props.name: left
props.description: The left CSS property of the Overlay — affects the horizontal position.

props.name: right
props.description: The right CSS property of the Overlay — affects the horizontal position.

props.name: bottom
props.description: The bottom CSS property of the Overlay — affects the vertical position.

props.name: position
props.description: The position CSS property of the Overlay — sets how the Overlay is positioned relative to its Portal

props.name: portalContainerName
props.description: If defined, Overlays will be rendered in the named portal. See also `Portal`.

props.name: caret
props.description: Sets the location of the caret. The format is [edge]-[position on edge]. For example, right-top will position the caret on the top of the right edge of the box. Use top

props.name: as
props.description: Sets the underlying HTML tag for the component

props.name: caret
props.description: Controls the position of the caret

props.name: open
props.description: Controls the visibility of the popover.

props.name: relative
props.description: Set to true to render the popover using relative positioning.

props.name: as
props.description: Sets the underlying HTML tag for the component

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Specifies the aria-label attribute, which is read verbatim by screen readers

props.name: icon
props.description: Checks the input by default in uncontrolled modeName of the [Octicon component](https://primer.style/octicons/) used in the

props.name: color
props.description: Sets an override color for the Octicon. Compatible with colors from the [Primer color system](https://primer.style/primitives/colors)."

props.name: size
props.description: Sets the uniform `width` and `height` of the SVG element

props.name: verticalAlign
props.description: Sets the `vertical-align` CSS property

props.name: actions
props.description: Place another element, such as a button, to the opposite side of the navigation items.

props.name: align
props.description: Use `right` to have navigation items aligned right.

props.name: full
props.description: Used to make navigation fill the width of the container.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Used to set the `aria-label` on the top level `<nav>` element.

props.name: direction
props.description: Sets where the tooltip renders in relation to the target.

props.name: noDelay
props.description: When set to `true`, tooltip appears without any delay.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Text used in `aria-label` (for accessibility)

props.name: wrap
props.description: Use `true` to allow text within tooltip to wrap.

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: Sets the max-width of the text.

props.name: inline
props.description: Displays text as inline block and vertical aligns to the top.

props.name: expandable
props.description: Allows the truncated text to be displayed on hover.

props.name: actions
props.description: Place another element, such as a button, to the opposite side of the navigation items.

props.name: align
props.description: Use `right` to have navigation items aligned right.

props.name: full
props.description: Used to make navigation fill the width of the container.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Used to set the `aria-label` on the top level `<nav>` element.

stories.code:
() => (
  <ActionList>
    <ActionList.Item>Copy link</ActionList.Item>
    <ActionList.Item>Quote reply</ActionList.Item>
    <ActionList.Item>Edit comment</ActionList.Item>
  </ActionList>
)

props.name: variant
props.description: `inset` children are offset (vertically and horizontally) from list edges. `full` children are flush (vertically and horizontally) with list edges

props.name: selectionVariant
props.description: Whether multiple items or a single item can be selected.

props.name: showDivider
props.description: Display a divider above each item in this list when it does not follow a header or divider.

props.name: role
props.description: ARIA role describing the function of the list. `listbox` and `menu` are a common values.

props.name: variant
props.description: `danger` indicates that the item is destructive.

props.name: onSelect
props.description: Callback that is called when the item is selected using either the mouse or keyboard.

props.name: selected
props.description: Indicate whether the item is selected. Only applies to items that can be selected.

props.name: active
props.description: Indicate whether the item is active. There should never be more than one active item.

props.name: disabled
props.description: Items that are disabled can not be clicked, selected, or navigated to.

props.name: role
props.description: ARIA role describing the function of the item. `option` is a common value.

props.name: active
props.description: Indicate whether the item is active. There should never be more than one active item.

props.name: children
props.description: Icon (or similar) positioned before item text.

props.name: children
props.description: Visual positioned after item text.

props.name: variant
props.description: `inline` descriptions are positioned beside primary text. `block` descriptions are positioned below primary text.

props.name: title
props.description: Title of the group.

props.name: auxiliaryText
props.description: Secondary text that provides additional information about the group.

props.name: variant
props.description: `inline` descriptions are positioned beside primary text. `block` descriptions are positioned below primary text.

props.name: selectionVariant
props.description: Set `selectionVariant` at the group level.

props.name: role
props.description: ARIA role describing the function of the list inside the group. `listbox` and `menu` are a common values.

stories.code:
() => (
  <ActionMenu>
    <ActionMenu.Button>Open menu</ActionMenu.Button>
    <ActionMenu.Overlay width="medium">
      <ActionList>
        <ActionList.Item onSelect={() => alert('Copy link clicked')}>
          Copy link
          <ActionList.TrailingVisual>⌘C</ActionList.TrailingVisual>
        </ActionList.Item>
        <ActionList.Item onSelect={() => alert('Quote reply clicked')}>
          Quote reply
          <ActionList.TrailingVisual>⌘Q</ActionList.TrailingVisual>
        </ActionList.Item>
        <ActionList.Item onSelect={() => alert('Edit comment clicked')}>
          Edit comment
          <ActionList.TrailingVisual>⌘E</ActionList.TrailingVisual>
        </ActionList.Item>
        <ActionList.Divider />
        <ActionList.Item
          variant="danger"
          onSelect={() => alert('Delete file clicked')}
        >
          Delete file
          <ActionList.TrailingVisual>⌘D</ActionList.TrailingVisual>
        </ActionList.Item>
      </ActionList>
    </ActionMenu.Overlay>
  </ActionMenu>
)

props.name: children
props.description: Recommended: `ActionMenu.Button` or `ActionMenu.Anchor` with `ActionMenu.Overlay`

props.name: open
props.description: If defined, will control the open/closed state of the overlay. Must be used in conjuction with `onOpenChange`.

props.name: onOpenChange
props.description: If defined, will control the open/closed state of the overlay. Must be used in conjuction with `open`.

props.name: anchorRef
props.description: Useful for defining an external anchor

props.name: children
props.description: Accepts a single child element

props.name: open
props.description: Determines whether the overlay portion of the component should be shown or not.

props.name: onOpen
props.description: A callback that is called whenever the overlay is currently closed and an "open gesture" is detected.

props.name: onClose
props.description: A callback that is called whenever the overlay is currently open and a "close gesture" is detected.

props.name: renderAnchor
props.description: A custom function component used to render the anchor element. When renderAnchor is null, an anchorRef is required.

props.name: anchorRef
props.description: An override to the internal `renderAnchor` ref that will be used to position the overlay. When `renderAnchor` is `null`, this can be used to make an anchor that is detached from ` AnchoredOverlay `.

props.name: anchorId
props.description: An override to the internal id that will be passed to the anchor.

props.name: overlayProps
props.description: Props to be spread on the internal `Overlay` component.

props.name: focusTrapSettings
props.description: Settings to apply to the focus trap on the internal `Overlay` component.

props.name: focusZoneSettings
props.description: Settings to apply to the focus zone on the internal `Overlay` component.

props.name: overlayProps
props.description: Props to be spread on the internal `Overlay` component.

props.name: items
props.description: The options for field values that are displayed in the dropdown menu. One or more may be selected depending on the value of the `selectionVariant` prop.

props.name: selectedItemIds
props.description: The IDs of the selected items

props.name: addNewItem
props.description: A menu item that is used to allow users make a selection that is not available in the array passed to the `items` prop. This menu item gets appended to the end of the list of options.

props.name: emptyStateText
props.description: The text that appears in the menu when there are no options in the array passed to the `items` prop.

props.name: filterFn
props.description: A custom function used to filter the options in the array passed to the `items` prop. By default, we filter out items that don't match the value of the autocomplete text input. The default filter is not case-sensitive.

props.name: loading
props.description: Whether the data is loading for the menu items

props.name: sortOnCloseFn
props.type: (itemIdA: string | number, itemIdB: string | number) => number
props.description: The sort function that is applied to the options in the array passed to the `items` prop after the user closes the menu. By default, selected items are sorted to the top after the user closes the menu.

props.name: selectionVariant
props.description: Whether there can be one item selected from the menu or multiple items selected from the menu

props.name: onOpenChange
props.description: Function that gets called when the menu is opened or closed

props.name: onSelectedChange
props.description: The function that is called when an item in the list is selected or deselected

props.name: customScrollContainerRef
props.description: If the menu is rendered in a scrolling element other than the `Autocomplete.Overlay` component, pass the ref of that element to `customScrollContainerRef` to ensure the container automatically scrolls when the user highlights an item in the menu that is outside the scroll container

props.name: checked
props.description: Modifies true/false value of the native checkbox

props.name: defaultChecked
props.description: Checks the input by default in uncontrolled mode

props.name: disabled
props.description: Modifies the native disabled state of the native checkbox

props.name: indeterminate
props.description: Applies an [ indeterminate state ](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/checkbox#attr-indeterminate) to the checkbox

props.name: onChange
props.description: A callback function that is triggered when the checked state has been changed

props.name: validationStatus
props.description:
Only used to inform ARIA attributes.
Individual checkboxes do not have validation styles.

props.name: value
props.description:
A unique value that is never shown to the user.
Used during form submission and to identify which checkbox inputs are selected.

stories.code:
() => (
  <CheckboxGroup>
    <CheckboxGroup.Label>Choices</CheckboxGroup.Label>
    <FormControl>
      <Checkbox value="one" defaultChecked />
      <FormControl.Label>Choice one</FormControl.Label>
    </FormControl>
    <FormControl>
      <Checkbox value="two" defaultChecked />
      <FormControl.Label>Choice two</FormControl.Label>
    </FormControl>
    <FormControl>
      <Checkbox value="three" />
      <FormControl.Label>Choice three</FormControl.Label>
    </FormControl>
  </CheckboxGroup>
)

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Used when associating the input group with a label other than CheckboxGroup.Label

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the input group allows user input

props.name: id
props.description:
The unique identifier for this input group. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text.
You may want a custom ID to make it easier to select elements in integration tests.

props.description: An onChange handler that gets called when the selection changes

props.name: children

props.name: children
props.description: The validation message

props.name: variant
props.description: Changes the visual style to match the validation status

props.name: scheme
props.description: Pass in 'primary' for a darker background and inverse text, or 'secondary' for a lighter background and primary text. Omitting the scheme prop renders the default counter scheme

props.name: aria-describedby
props.description: Provide an id to an element which uniquely describes this table

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Provide an id to an element which uniquely labels this table

props.name: data
props.description: Provide a collection of the rows which will be rendered inside of the table

props.name: columns
props.description: Provide the columns for the table and the fields in `data` to which they correspond

props.name: cellPadding
props.description: Specify the amount of space that should be available around the contents of a cell

props.name: aria-describedby
props.description: Provide an id to an element which uniquely describes this table

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Provide an id to an element which uniquely labels this table

props.name: cellPadding
props.description: Specify the amount of space that should be available around the contents of a cell

props.name: scope
props.description: Provide the scope for a table cell, useful for defining a row header using `scope="row"`

props.name: title
props.description: Title of the Dialog. Also serves as the aria-label for this Dialog.

props.name: subtitle
props.description: The Dialog's subtitle. Optional. Rendered below the title in smaller type with less contrast. Also serves as the aria-describedby for this Dialog.

props.name: renderHeader
props.description: Provide a custom renderer for the dialog header. This content is rendered directly into the dialog body area, full bleed from edge to edge, top to the start of the body element. Warning: using a custom renderer may violate Primer UX principles.

props.name: renderBody
props.description: Provide a custom render function for the dialog body. This content is rendered directly into the dialog body area, full bleed from edge to edge, header to footer. Warning: using a custom renderer may violate Primer UX principles.

props.name: renderFooter
props.description: Provide a custom render function for the dialog footer. This content is rendered directly into the dialog footer area, full bleed from edge to edge, end of the body element to bottom. Warning: using a custom renderer may violate Primer UX principles.

props.name: footerButtons
props.description: Specifies the buttons to be rendered in the Dialog footer.

props.name: onClose
props.description: This method is invoked when a gesture to close the dialog is used (either an Escape key press or clicking the 'X' in the top-right corner). The gesture argument indicates the gesture that was used to close the dialog (either 'close-button' or 'escape').

props.name: role
props.description: The ARIA role to assign to this dialog.

props.name: href

props.description: The URL that the item navigates to. `href` is passed to the underlying `<a>` element. If `as` is specified, the component may need different props. If the item contains a sub-nav, the item is rendered as a `<button>` and `href` is ignored.

props.name: aria-current
props.description: Set `aria-current` to `"page"` to indicate that the item represents the current page. Set `aria-current` to `"location"` to indicate that the item represents the current location on a page. For more information about `aria-current`, see [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-current).

props.description: Whether the header is hidden.

props.name: hidden
props.type: | boolean | { narrow?: boolean regular?: boolean wide?: boolean }
props.description: Whether the content is hidden.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Label for the pane. Required if the pane overflows and doesn't have aria-labelledby.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Id of an element that acts as a label for the pane. Required if the pane overflows and doesn't have aria-label.

props.name: positionWhenNarrow
props.description: Use the position prop with a responsive value instead.

props.name: width
props.description: The width of the pane.

props.name: resizable
props.description: When true, the pane may be resized by the user.

props.name: widthStorageKey
props.description: Provide a key used by localStorage to persist the size of the pane on the client.

props.name: sticky
props.description: Whether the pane should stick to the top of the screen while the content scrolls.

props.name: offsetHeader
props.description: Use offsetHeader along with the sticky prop to push the sticky pane down to make room for a sticky header if necessary. Use the type `string` to specify the height with a unit i.e. 5rem; otherwise the type `number` will be taken as px.

props.name: padding
props.description: The amount of padding inside the pane.

props.name: dividerWhenNarrow
props.description: Use the divider prop with a responsive value instead.

props.name: hidden
props.type: | boolean | { narrow?: boolean regular?: boolean wide?: boolean }
props.description: Whether the pane is hidden.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: A unique label for the rendered contentinfo landmark

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: An id to an element which uniquely labels the rendered contentinfo landmark

props.name: padding
props.description: The amount of padding inside the footer.

props.name: dividerWhenNarrow
props.description: Use the divider prop with a responsive value instead.

props.name: hidden
props.type: | boolean | { narrow?: boolean regular?: boolean wide?: boolean }
props.description: Whether the footer is hidden.

props.name: as

props.name: marginPageCount

props.name: onPageChange

props.name: showPages

props.name: surroundingPageCount

props.name: containerName
props.description: Renders the portal children into the container registered with the given name. If omitted, children are rendered into the default portal root.

props.name: aria-labelledby
props.description: Used when associating the input group with a label other than RadioGroup.Label

props.name: disabled

props.name: id
props.description:
The unique identifier for this input group. Used to associate the label, validation text, and caption text.
You may want a custom ID to make it easier to select elements in integration tests.

props.name: name
props.description: The name used to identify this group of radios

props.name: onChange
props.description: An onChange handler that gets called when the selection changes

props.name: required
props.description: If true, the user must make a selection before the owning form can be submitted

props.name: visuallyHidden
props.description: If true, the fieldset legend will be visually hidden

props.name: children

props.name: children
props.description: The validation message

props.name: variant
props.description: Changes the visual style to match the validation status

props.name: date

props.name: format
props.description: The format with which to display the time

props.name: tense
props.description: The tense to use when displaying a relative time

props.name: precision
props.description: The precision to use when displaying an elapsed time

props.name: threshold
props.description: The threshold (ISO8601 duration) to display relative dates within

props.name: prefix
props.description: The prefix to use when displaying a localised (non relative) date

props.name: second
props.description: The format with which to render seconds

props.name: minute
props.description: The format with which to render minutes

props.name: hour
props.description: The format with which to render hours

props.name: weekday

props.name: day

props.name: month

props.name: year

props.name: timeZoneName

props.name: selected
props.description: Whether the segment is selected. This is used for controlled SegmentedControls, and needs to be updated using the onChange handler on SegmentedControl.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Allows input to be accessible.

props.name: block
props.description: Creates a full-width input element

props.name: contrast
props.description: Changes background color to a higher contrast color

props.name: size
props.description: Creates a smaller or larger input than the default.

props.name: loading
props.description: Whether to show a loading indicator in the input

props.name: loaderPosition
props.description:
Which position to render the loading indicator
  • 'auto' (default): at the end of the input, unless a `leadingVisual` is passed. Then, it will render at the beginning
  • 'leading': at the beginning of the input
  • 'trailing': at the end of the input

props.name: leadingVisual
props.description: Visual positioned on the left edge inside the input

props.name: monospace
props.description: Shows input in monospace font

props.name: trailingVisual
props.description: Visual positioned on the right edge inside the input

props.name: trailingAction
props.description: A visual that renders inside the input after the typing area

props.name: validationStatus
props.description: Style the input to match the status

props.name: variant
props.description: (Use size) Creates a smaller or larger input than the default.

props.name: width
props.description: (Use sx prop) Set the width of the input

props.name: maxWidth
props.description: (Use sx prop) Set the maximum width of the input

props.name: minWidth
props.description: (Use sx prop) Set the minimum width of the input

props.name: icon
props.description: (Use leadingVisual or trailingVisual) An Octicon React component. To be used inside of input. Positioned on the left edge.

props.name: aria-label
props.description: Text that appears in a tooltip. If an icon is passed, this is also used as the label used by assistive technologies.

props.name: tooltipDirection
props.description: Sets where the tooltip renders in relation to the target.

props.name: icon
props.description: The icon to render inside the button

props.name: variant
props.description: (Deprecated so that only the 'invisible' variant is used) Determine's the styles on a button

props.name: tokens
props.description: The array of tokens to render

props.name: onTokenRemove
props.description: The function that gets called when a token is removed

props.name: tokenComponent
props.description: The component used to render each token

props.name: maxHeight
props.description: The maximum height of the component. If the content in the input exceeds this height, it will scroll vertically

props.name: preventTokenWrapping
props.description: Whether tokens should render inline horizontally. By default, tokens wrap to new lines

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the tokens and text input

props.name: hideTokenRemoveButtons
props.description: Whether the remove buttons should be rendered in the tokens

props.name: validationStatus
props.description: Style the input to match the status

props.name: visibleTokenCount
props.description: The number of tokens to display before truncating

props.name: aria-describedby

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the switch is ready for user input

props.name: loading
props.description: Whether the switch's value is being calculated

props.name: checked
props.description: Whether the switch is turned on

props.name: onChange
props.description: The callback that is called when the switch is toggled on or off

props.name: onClick
props.description: The callback that is called when the switch is clicked

props.name: size
props.description: Size of the switch

props.name: statusLabelPosition
props.description:
Whether the "on" and "off" labels should appear before or after the switch.
This should only be changed when the switch's alignment needs to be adjusted. For example: It needs to be left-aligned because the label appears above it and the caption appears below it.

stories.code:
() => (
  <nav aria-label="Files changed">
    <TreeView aria-label="Files changed">
      <TreeView.Item id="src" defaultExpanded>
        <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
        </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
        src
        <TreeView.SubTree>
          <TreeView.Item id="src/Avatar.tsx">
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <FileIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            Avatar.tsx
            <TreeView.TrailingVisual>
              <StyledOcticon
                icon={DiffAddedIcon}
                color="success.fg"
                aria-label="added"
              />
            </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
          </TreeView.Item>
          <TreeView.Item id="src/Button.tsx" current>
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <FileIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            Button.tsx
            <TreeView.TrailingVisual>
              <StyledOcticon
                icon={DiffModifiedIcon}
                color="attention.fg"
                aria-label="modified"
              />
            </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
          </TreeView.Item>
        </TreeView.SubTree>
      </TreeView.Item>
      <TreeView.Item id="package.json">
        <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          <FileIcon />
        </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
        package.json
        <TreeView.TrailingVisual>
          <StyledOcticon
            icon={DiffModifiedIcon}
            color="attention.fg"
            aria-label="modified"
          />
        </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
      </TreeView.Item>
    </TreeView>
  </nav>
)

() => (
  <nav aria-label="Files">
    <TreeView aria-label="Files">
      <TreeView.Item id="src" defaultExpanded>
        <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
        </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
        src
        <TreeView.SubTree>
          <TreeView.Item id="src/Avatar.tsx">
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <FileIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            Avatar.tsx
          </TreeView.Item>
          <TreeView.Item id="src/Button" current>
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            Button
            <TreeView.SubTree>
              <TreeView.Item id="src/Button/Button.tsx">
                <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                  <FileIcon />
                </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                Button.tsx
              </TreeView.Item>
              <TreeView.Item id="src/Button/Button.test.tsx">
                <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                  <FileIcon />
                </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                Button.test.tsx
              </TreeView.Item>
            </TreeView.SubTree>
          </TreeView.Item>
          <TreeView.Item id="src/ReallyLongFileNameThatShouldBeTruncated.tsx">
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <FileIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            ReallyLongFileNameThatShouldBeTruncated.tsx
          </TreeView.Item>
        </TreeView.SubTree>
      </TreeView.Item>
      <TreeView.Item
        id="public"
        // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
        onExpandedChange={(isExpanded) =>
          console.log(
            `${isExpanded ? 'Expanded' : 'Collapsed'} "public" folder `,
          )
        }
      >
        <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
        </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
        public
        <TreeView.SubTree>
          <TreeView.Item id="public/index.html">
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <FileIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            index.html
          </TreeView.Item>
          <TreeView.Item id="public/favicon.ico">
            <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              <FileIcon />
            </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            favicon.ico
          </TreeView.Item>
        </TreeView.SubTree>
      </TreeView.Item>
      <TreeView.Item id="package.json">
        <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          <FileIcon />
        </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
        package.json
      </TreeView.Item>
    </TreeView>
  </nav>
)

() => {
  return (
    <nav aria-label="Files">
      <TreeView aria-label="Files">
        <TreeView.Item id="src" defaultExpanded>
          <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
          </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          src
          <TreeView.SubTree>
            <TreeView.Item id="src/Avatar.tsx">
              <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                <FileIcon />
              </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              Avatar.tsx
              <TreeView.TrailingVisual label="added">
                <StyledOcticon icon={DiffAddedIcon} color="success.fg" />
              </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
            </TreeView.Item>
            <TreeView.Item id="src/Button" defaultExpanded>
              <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
              </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              Button
              <TreeView.SubTree>
                <TreeView.Item id="src/Button/Button.tsx" current>
                  <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                    <FileIcon />
                  </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                  Button.tsx
                  <TreeView.TrailingVisual label="modified">
                    <StyledOcticon
                      icon={DiffModifiedIcon}
                      color="attention.fg"
                    />
                  </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
                </TreeView.Item>
                <TreeView.Item id="src/Button/Button.test.tsx">
                  <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                    <FileIcon />
                  </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                  Button.test.tsx
                  <TreeView.TrailingVisual label="modified">
                    <StyledOcticon
                      icon={DiffModifiedIcon}
                      color="attention.fg"
                    />
                  </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
                </TreeView.Item>
              </TreeView.SubTree>
            </TreeView.Item>
            <TreeView.Item id="src/ReallyLongFileNameThatShouldBeTruncated.tsx">
              <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                <FileIcon />
              </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              ReallyLongFileNameThatShouldBeTruncated.tsx
              <TreeView.TrailingVisual label="modified">
                <StyledOcticon icon={DiffModifiedIcon} color="attention.fg" />
              </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
            </TreeView.Item>
          </TreeView.SubTree>
        </TreeView.Item>
        <TreeView.Item id="public" defaultExpanded>
          <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
            <TreeView.DirectoryIcon />
          </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
          public
          <TreeView.SubTree>
            <TreeView.Item id="public/index.html">
              <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                <FileIcon />
              </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              index.html
              <TreeView.TrailingVisual label="renamed">
                <StyledOcticon icon={DiffRenamedIcon} />
              </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
            </TreeView.Item>
            <TreeView.Item id="public/favicon.ico">
              <TreeView.LeadingVisual>
                <FileIcon />
              </TreeView.LeadingVisual>
              favicon.ico
              <TreeView.TrailingVisual label="removed">
                <StyledOcticon icon={DiffRemovedIcon} color="danger.fg" />
              </TreeView.TrailingVisual>
            </TreeView.Item>
          </TreeView.SubTree>
        </TreeView.Item>
      </TreeView>
    </nav>
  )
}

props.name: flat
props.description: Prevents the tree from indenting items. This should only be used when the tree is used to display a flat list of items.

props.name: id
props.description: A unique identifier for the item.

props.name: current
props.description: Indicates whether the item is the current item. No more than one item should be current at once. The path to the current item will be expanded by default.

props.name: defaultExpanded
props.description: The expanded state of the item when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control the state.

props.name: expanded
props.description: The controlled expanded state of item. Must be used in conjunction with onExpandedChange.

props.name: containIntrinsicSize
props.description: The size of this item's contents. Passing this will set 'content-visiblity: auto' on the content container, delaying rendering until the item is in the viewport.

props.name: onExpandedChange
props.description: Event handler called when the expanded state of the item changes.

props.name: label
props.description: Provide an accessible label for the visual. This is not necessary for decorative visuals.

props.name: label
props.description: Provide an accessible label for the visual. This is not necessary for decorative visuals.

props.name: state
props.description: Specify a state if items in the subtree are loaded asynchronously. An asynchronous subtree can be in one of the following states: 'initial', 'loading', 'done', or 'error'. In the 'initial' state, items are neither loaded nor loading. In the 'loading' state, items are loading and the subtree will render a loading indicator. In the 'done' state, items are loaded. Screen readers will announce when a subtree enters the 'done' state. An 'error' state means that an error occured while loading items.

props.name: count
props.description: The number of items expected to be in the subtree. When in the loading state, the subtree will render a skeleton loading placeholder with the specified count of items

props.name: children
props.description: The content of the dialog. This is usually a message explaining the error.

props.name: title
props.description: The title of the dialog. This is usually a short description of the error.

props.name: onRetry
props.description: Event handler called when the user clicks the retry button.

props.name: onDismiss
props.description: Event handler called when the dialog is dismissed.

props.name: afterSelect
props.description: The handler that gets called when a nav link child is selected

props.name: aria-label
props.description:
A unique name for the rendered 'nav' landmark. It will also be used to label the arrow
buttons that control the scroll behaviour on coarse pointer devices. (I.e.
'Scroll ${aria-label} left/right')

props.name: loadingCounters
props.description: Whether the navigation items are in loading state. Component waits for all the counters to finish loading to prevent multiple layout shifts.

props.name: aria-current
props.description: Set `aria-current` to `"page"` to indicate that the item represents the current page. Set `aria-current` to `"location"` to indicate that the item represents the current location on a page. For more information about `aria-current`, see [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-current).

props.name: counter
props.description: The number to display in the counter label.

props.name: href
props.description: The URL that the item navigates to. 'href' is passed to the underlying '<a>' element. If 'as' is specified, the component may need different props and 'href' is ignored. (Required prop for the react router is 'to' for example)

props.name: icon
props.description: The leading icon comes before item label

props.name: onSelect
props.description: The handler that gets called when a nav link is selected. For example, a manual route binding can be done here(I.e. 'navigate(href)' for the react router.)

props.name: children
props.description: An `input` or `textarea` compatible component to extend. A compatible component is any component that forwards a ref and props to an underlying `input` or `textarea` element, including but not limited to `Input`, `TextArea`, `input`, `textarea`, `styled.input`, and `styled.textarea`. If the child is not compatible, a runtime `TypeError` will be thrown.

props.name: triggers
props.description: Register the triggers that can cause suggestions to appear.

props.name: onShowSuggestions
props.description: Called when a valid suggestion query is updated. This should be handled by setting the `suggestions` prop accordingly.

props.name: onShowSuggestions
props.description: Called when suggestions should be hidden. Set `suggestions` to `null` or an empty array in this case.

props.name: suggestions
props.description: The currently visible list of suggestions. If `loading`, a loading indicator will be shown. If `null` or empty, the list will be hidden. Suggestion sort will be preserved. Typically, this should not contain more than five or so suggestions.

props.name: tabInsertsSuggestions
props.description: If `true`, suggestions will be applied with both `Tab` and `Enter`, instead of just `Enter`. This may be expected behavior for users used to IDEs, but use caution when hijacking browser tabbing capability.

props.name: value
props.description: Current value of the editor as a multiline markdown string.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Called when the value changes.

props.name: onRenderPreview
props.description: Accepts Markdown and returns rendered HTML. To prevent XSS attacks, the HTML should be sanitized and/or come from a trusted source.

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disable the editor and all related buttons. Users can still switch between preview & edit modes.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder text to show when the editor is empty. By default, no placeholder will be shown.

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximum number of characters the markdown can hold (includes formatting characters like `*`).

props.name: fullHeight
props.description: Force the editor to take up the full height of the container and disallow resizing. Only use when the container height is tall enough that the user will never want to expand the input further, ie when it takes the full height of the viewport.

props.name: markdownValue
props.description: The markdown the HTML was rendered from. This is not used for viewing, only as a source for change events.

props.name: dangerousRenderHTML
props.description: Set the rendered HTML of the viewer. To prevent XSS, ensure that the source of this HTML is trusted!

props.name: loading
props.description: Show a loading spinner instead of content.

props.name: onLinkClick
props.description: Called when the user clicks a link element. This can be used to intercept the click and provide custom routing. Note that this is a native HTML `MouseEvent` and not a `React.ClickEvent`.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Called when the user interacts and updates the Markdown. The rendered Markdown is updated eagerly - if the request fails, a rejected Promise should be returned by this handler. In that case, the viewer will revert the visual change. If the change is handled by an async API request (as it typically will be in production code), the viewer should be `disabled` while the request is pending to avoid conflicts. To allow users to check multiple boxes rapidly, the API request should be debounced (an ideal debounce duration is about 1 second).

props.name: disabled
props.description: Control whether interaction is disabled.
